2024 September
Definition of Streaming

Streaming refers to any live or recorded content that is available on the online media through using devices such as computers, cellphones, and etc.

2024 September
Types of Streaming Content

Video game, Movies, TV shows, Music Videos, Webcast, Podcast, Fitness training, Educational content and Vlogs.

2024 September
Platforms Used for Streaming

There are numerous platforms available for streaming, such as Netflix, YouTube, Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube Music, Hulu, Disney+, Apple TV, SoundCloud, Twitch, Facebook, Amazon Prime Video, Tubi, Peacock, iHeartRadio, and CrunchyRoll.

2024 September
The Needs of Viewers

According to a study by Marvin, R. (2019) Viewers of streaming content primarily seek a diverse and extensive library of content that includes movies, exclusive original series, and popular shows. They value high-quality, engaging content that caters to their varied interests, such as dramas, documentaries, and sports programming.

2024 September
The Needs of Viewers

Additionally, the ease of use and accessibility of the streaming platform are crucial, as viewers prefer intuitive interfaces that allow them to find and enjoy content effortlessly.Interactive features, such as live streaming with real-time feedback and community engagement, also enhance the viewing experience by fostering a sense of connection and loyalty. Overall, a combination of rich content variety, user-friendly design, and interactive elements meets the evolving needs of streaming audiences.

2024 September
Characteristics of a Good Stream

A good stream is characterized by five elements. Engagement is important, as actively interacting with viewers helps create a community feeling. A captivating and relatable personality is helps maintain viewer interest. High production quality, including good video and audio, enhances the viewing experience. Consistency in streaming schedules helps build a loyal viewer base. Additionally, engaging with viewers on social media fosters a sense of community.
